Articles.Content: Hi! I'm getting an issue with the SM-25 Service Module, no fuel is getting to my engine from it, it just says I'm out of oxidizer, and I can't build my ship because of that
Detailed screenshots of the ship and/or a craft file would help.  I don't use the SM-25 much, but the last time I used it, it was working normally

On 6/7/2019 at 4:22 PM, Cavscout74 said:

Detailed screenshots ﻿of the ship and/or a craft file would help.  I don't use the SM-25 much﻿, but the last time I used it, it was working normally

Sorry for the delay, here's a screenshot of the ship. https://solenxia.site/imgs/cz8lu

I totally got sidetracked on this, I'll have to try tonight & see what mine does.   Is that an engine plate on the bottom of the SM-25?  If it is, it shouldn't block fuel flow to the attached engine, but it makes me wonder if it's interacting with the SM-25 in a strange way.

So, I just confirmed I'm having the same issue.  I even used a different fuel tank, but the same engine.  So then I tried it with a Poodle instead of a Wolfhound, and still the same issue.  For what it's worth, as of version 1.6 (I think), it was in fact working like an Apollo-style service module, and the fuel & oxidizer in the SM were available to an attached engine.

 

Update:  I was looking in the Bugtracker and I think this has already been reported as a bug:

https://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/21141

 

Edited June 11, 2019 by Cavscout74

On 6/10/2019 at 6:28 PM, Cavscout74 said:

So, I just confirmed I'm having the same issue.  I even used a different fuel tank, but the same ﻿engine.  So then I tried it with a Poodle instead of a Wolfhound, and still the same issue.  For what it's worth, as of version 1.6 (I think), it was in fact working like an Apollo-style service module, and the fuel & oxidizer in the SM were available to an attached engine.

 

Update:  I was looking in the Bugtracker and I think this has already been reported as a bug:

Awesome! Happy I'm not the only one
